page.title: 01Introducing Moy
page.content: MOY-Magh in Gaelic meaning meadow or plain is situated 12 miles south east of INVERNESS. It stands 275 metres above sea level with the surrounding hills rising to 600 metres. Much snow can be expected in winter. The area around Moy is made up of farmland and forestry. In 1945 the landowner of the time _ the 29th Chief of MACKINTOSH _ fued 2000 acres to the Forestry Commission. The present chief _ Lachlan the 30th Chief _ lives in Moy Hall which is situated to the north of Loch Moy. The present Moy Hall is the fourth Moy Hall and was completed in 1957. In Loch Moy there are two islands. On one stands a tall granite obelisk erected by Dame Margaret Mackintosh in memory of her husband Aeneas 23rd Chief. The second island _ a clachan and home for birds _ was a prison.
